references.paper_title: Modeling purposeful adaptive behavior with the principle of maximum causal entropy
references.reason: This paper introduces the maximum causal entropy (MCE) framework, which is adapted and extended in the current work to define and measure goal-directedness.
This foundational paper on inverse reinforcement learning provides the basis for the current work's approach to inferring goals from behavior.
This highly influential work in philosophy of mind underpins the theoretical framework of the current paper, providing justification for the instrumentalist approach to agency.
This book provides the foundation for causal Bayesian networks, the model used in this paper to represent causal relationships and measure goal-directedness.
This paper proposes a causal discovery algorithm for identifying agents and serves as a point of comparison and contrast, highlighting the advantages of the current approach.
